    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public LocalModel copy()
        creates a copy of the model. Observers are not copied.
        Returns:
        a copy of the model.

      • addPushObserver

        public void addPushObserver(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Integer> observer)
        adds a pushObserver, a Consumer function to be applied to a literal which just became true.
        Parameters:
        observer - a Consumer function to be applied to a literal.

      • addSatisfiableObserver

        public void addSatisfiableObserver(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> observer)
        adds a satisfiableObserver, a Consumer function to be applied either when all predicates became assigned, or when the clause list became empty.
        Parameters:
        observer - a Consumer function to be applied to a string ("full" or "empty") and the last literal.

      • addUnsatisfiableObserver

        public void addUnsatisfiableObserver(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> observer)
        adds an unsatisfiableObserver, a Consumer function to be applied when an inconsistency has been detected
        Parameters:
        observer - a Consumer function to be applied to a string ("literal" or "clause") and either an inconsistent literal or the empty clause number.

      • push

        public short push(int literal)
        pushes a literal onto the model and checks if the literal is already in the model.
        Parameters:
        literal - the literal for the model.
        Returns:
        +1 if the literal was already in the model, -1 if the negated literal was in the model, otherwise 0.

      • flip

        public void flip(int literal)
        flips the truth value of the literal
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal

      • pop

        public int pop()
        pops the last literal from the model.
        Returns:
        the popped literal, or 0 if the model is empty.

      • isTrue

        public boolean isTrue(int literal)
        checks if the literal is true in the model.
        Parameters:
        literal - the literal to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the literal is true in the model.

      • isFalse

        public boolean isFalse(int literal)
        checks if the literal is false in the model.
        Parameters:
        literal - the literal to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the literal is false in the model.

      • status

        public short status(int literal)
        returns the status of the literal in the model.
        Parameters:
        literal - the literal to be checked
        Returns:
        +1 if the literal is true in the model, -1 if it is false in the model, otherwise 0.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int literal)
        checks if the literal is in the model.
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        Returns:
        true if the model contains the literal.

        returns the current size of the model.

        the current size of the model

        checks if the model is empty.
        Returns:

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        checks if the model is full.
        Returns:
